pr_title: Quote column name in Phoenix CREATE TABLE statement

timeline.message:
Quote column name in Phoenix CREATE TABLE statement

Additionally, enable testColumnName test in Phoenix.

timeline.bodyText: @vincentpoon should we go thru toMetadataCasing here before calling getEscapedArgument?
timeline.author: findepi

replies.bodyText:
Hmm this code doesn't look right to me (I think it was from another PR I based my original one off of).  Firstly, connection.getMetaData().storesUpperCaseIdentifiers() would always return true, so the method toMetadataCasing isn't really needed.
Phoenix uppercases identifiers if they aren't quoted.
If they are quoted, then it's case sensitive.
Is there a way for us to tell in Presto whether the user quoted the identifier or not?  Because it seems we should base the uppercase decision off that.
replies.author: vincentpoon
